title: Clondavaddog
text:
Clondavaddog is a parish in the <a href="Roman%20Catholic%20Diocese%20of%20Raphoe">Diocese of Raphoe</a>. Clondavaddog is situated at the northern part of the <a href="Fanad%20peninsula">Fanad peninsula</a> in <a href="County%20Donegal">County Donegal</a> in <a href="Ulster">Ulster</a>, <a href="Ireland">Ireland</a>.
History.
The most relevant event in Irish history to have happened locally was the killing of the pro-British local Protestant minister, <a href="The%20Reverend">The Rev.</a> <a href="William%20Hamilton%20%28Irish%20minister%29">William Hamilton</a>, in March 1797, by an angry mob. This was one of several precursors to the <a href="Irish%20Rebellion%20of%201798">Irish Rebellion of 1798</a>.
